com.epoch.db

Class UserWrite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.db.DBCommon
      • com.epoch.db.UserWrite

  • public final class UserWrite
extends DBCommon
    Database read-write operations related to students and instructors.

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • addUser

        public static void addUser(User user)
                    throws DBException,
                           UniquenessException,
                           StudentNumConstraintException,
                           StudentEmailExistsException
        Adds a new user; may also add a new institution or change the name of the institution's student ID number.
        Parameters:
        user - User containing the new information
        Throws:
        UniquenessException - when the login already exists
        StudentNumConstraintException - when the student's ID number already exists at this institution and the student is not an exam student (temporary login)
        StudentEmailExistsException - when the student's email already exists at this institution and the student is not an exam student (temporary login)
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

                                   int courseId)
                            throws DBException
        Adds temporary logins for use in exams to the users and exam-students tables.
        Parameters:
        students - exam-students
        courseId - ID of the course with which they are associated
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • addUsers

        private static void addUsers(Connection con,
                             User[] users)
                      throws SQLException,
                             UniquenessException,
                             StudentNumConstraintException,
                             StudentEmailExistsException
        Adds new users. Connection autocommit should be set to false before coming here.
        Parameters:
        con - database connection
        users - array of Users containing the new information
        Throws:
        UniquenessException - when the login already exists
        StudentNumConstraintException - when the student's ID number already exists at this institution and the student is not an exam student (temporary login)
        StudentEmailExistsException - when the student's email already exists at this institution and the student is not an exam student (temporary login)
        SQLException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • setUser

        public static void setUser(User user)
                    throws DBException,
                           UniquenessException,
                           StudentNumConstraintException,
                           StudentEmailExistsException
        Changes a user's information; may also add a new institution or change the name of the institution's student ID number. Disallows student changing student ID number to one already chosen by another student at the same institution, unless the student is working in an account created for exams. Also disallows student changing email address to one already used by a student with a different student ID number at the same institution. If user is a student and studentNum or institution changes, also enrolls the student in courses in which he or she is preenrolled, although it does NOT disenroll the student from any courses.
        Parameters:
        user - User containing the new information
        Throws:
        UniquenessException - when the login already exists
        StudentNumConstraintException - when the student's ID number already exists at this institution and the student is not an exam student (temporary login)
        StudentEmailExistsException - when the student's email already exists at this institution and the student is not an exam student (temporary login)
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • setMayNotSeeSynthCalcdProds

        public static void setMayNotSeeSynthCalcdProds(String userId)
                                        throws DBException
        For all users who have the same institution and student ID number as the given student, sets their flags so they cannot see calculated synthesis products in the feedback in any course. Used when entering an exam assignment. If an exam account is being used by a student, works on both the exam account and the student's original account, assuming same institution and student ID number in both.
        Parameters:
        userId - the user's ID
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • removeUser

        public static void removeUser(String userId)
                       throws DBException
        Removes a user. If an instructor, removes locally authored questions, courses, assignments, responses to those assignments, coinstructorships, locally authored question sets, modified common question statements, authoring privileges. If a student, removes responses, instantiated assignments, and enrollment records.
        Parameters:
        userId - login ID of user
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • removeUsers

        public static List<String[]> removeUsers(String[] userIds)
                                  throws DBException
        Removes users. Divides the users among instructors and students. Removes instructors' locally authored questions, courses, assignments, responses to those assignments, coinstructorships, locally authored question sets, modified common question statements, authoring privileges, languages. Removes students' responses, instantiated assignments, watched forum topics, and enrollment records.
        Parameters:
        userIds - array of login ID of users
        Returns:
        list of two-string arrays containing name and email address of removed users
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • removeInactiveStudents

        public static List<String[]> removeInactiveStudents(int[] y_m_d,
                                                    int instnId)
        Deletes users who have no responses and have not logged in since a particular date.
        Parameters:
        y_m_d - int array of years, months, days
        instnId - the ID of the institution, or all of them, whose students have been inactive
        Returns:
        list of two-string arrays containing name and email address of removed users

      • changeUserId

        public static void changeUserId(String newUserId,
                                int instnId,
                                String studentNum)
                         throws DBException
        Saves a new userId for a student at the institution and with the student ID number, and changes the same value in all other tables whose fields point to this one. Used to fix userIds with non-ASCII characters. The table needs to be altered once by direct SQL commands. For example: 
         ALTER TABLE cw_course_enrollment_v3
 DROP CONSTRAINT f_enroll3_student;

 ALTER TABLE cw_course_enrollment_v3 
 ADD CONSTRAINT f_enroll3_student
 FOREIGN KEY (student_id)
 REFERENCES users_v4 (user_id)
 ON UPDATE CASCADE;
        It appears this needs to be done for every foreign key pointing to users_v4.user_id.
        Parameters:
        newUserId - the new userId
        instnId - the institution ID
        studentNum - the student number at that institution
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

                               String language)

        Adds a new language for a user.

                                  int removePosn)
                           throws DBException
        Removes one of this user's languages.
        Parameters:
        userId - login ID of the user
        removePosn - 1-based position of the language to be removed, in the current order of the languages
